plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A species of daffodil native to Western Europe, known for its bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers. It often carpets woodlands and meadows in early spring.
plants.funFact: Wild daffodils are often the first sign of spring in many parts of Europe and were historically used to scent perfumes.

plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning display of pink to white blossoms. It is culturally significant in Japan and widely planted around the world as an ornamental tree.
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms only bloom for about one to two weeks, symbolizing the fleeting nature of life in Japanese culture.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: A large shrub with spectacular flower heads resembling giant artichokes. Native to South Africa, it blooms mostly in late winter to early spring.
plants.funFact: The King Protea is South Africa‚Äôs national flower, and its name is derived from the Greek god Proteus, symbolizing diversity.

plants.name: Magnolia stellata
plants.description: A small deciduous tree or large shrub producing star-shaped white to pale pink flowers early in spring before the leaves appear.
plants.location: Japan and widely cultivated in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Star magnolias are among the earliest flowering magnolias and their flowers can sometimes tolerate frost.
